definition: to give up/to abandon (a goal etc)/to let sth go/forget it/let the matter drop
(final particle, same as 吧)
to stop/to cease/to dismiss/to suspend/to quit/to finish
surname Xiu
to rest/to stop doing sth for a period of time/to cease/(imperative) don't

sentences.english: Set your goals high, and don't stop till you get there.
sentences.chinese: 树立远大的目标，不达目的誓不罢休。

sentences.english: He is an honest man, and he never has an ax to grind.
sentences.chinese: 他是个不达目的决不罢休的人。

sentences.english: They are about to the stance with ritual, and get straight to the blood bleeding.
sentences.chinese: 他们注重礼节，采取硬碰硬，直到出血才罢休。

sentences.english: We'll never stop until we reach our goal.
He's a man who sticks at it until it's finished.
sentences.chinese: 他是那种不达目的决不罢休的人。

sentences.english: Y yo no me lo callo.
To ambitious goals, never give up to reach the goal.
sentences.chinese: 目标要远大，不达目的决不罢休。

sentences.english: Not yet, however, in spite of her disappointment in her husband, did Mrs.
sentences.chinese: 班纳特太太虽然碰了一鼻子灰，可是并不甘心罢休。

sentences.english: But we can’t stop there, because binary files now await us.
sentences.chinese: 但我们还不能罢休，因为二进制文件还在等着我们。

sentences.english: If you are right your choice is confident, and do not surmount swear not to stop.
sentences.chinese: 假如你对你的选择布满信心，而且不超越誓不罢休。

sentences.english: I wont stop until I reach my goals.
I' m such a perfectionist that I won't stop until a job is well done.
sentences.chinese: 工作做得不文雅，我是不会罢休的。

sentences.english: Set your goals , and don't stop till you get there.
sentences.chinese: 树立远大目标，不达目的誓不罢休。

sentences.english: My cousins and I usually played it just before dark.
sentences.chinese: 我和我表弟们经常玩躲猫猫到天黑才罢休。

sentences.english: Dirk Kuyt insists he will not rest until he achieves his dream of becoming a Barclays Premier League champion with Liverpool.
sentences.chinese: 库伊特坚称不帮助利物浦夺取联赛冠军誓不罢休。

definition: to give up
to leave the matter at that/to be prepared to let go/to be willing to take things lying down
old variant of 肯[ken3]
to agree/to consent/to be ready (to do sth)/willing
to let off/to let slip by/to let sb get away with sth
not to overlook, nor spare (idiom); unwilling to forgive/to treat severely without listening to excuses
to let go of sth held in one's mouth/(fig.) to relent/to yield
to rest/to take a break
to be willing to/to resign oneself to
to let matters rest
to stop/to pull back
to kill to the last one (idiom)/to exterminate/to eradicate/ruthless
to give up/to admit failure/to drop the matter/to reconcile oneself to loss/to have no more illusions about
determined/unshakable
to drop (subject etc)
see 鬆口|松口[song1 kou3]
lit. to eat one's words/to break a promise/to go back on one's word/to renege/unsworn testimony
